Hi and welcome to the group.

You have many questions, and I'd suggest look=
ing through messages on this group and checking out Wikipedia to get a basi=
c idea of things.

1: Samurai armor is basically made up of many parts that=
 are tied together. There are many different styles and types of armor, but=
 have a look at images on the web and you'll get some idea.

2: A Samurai's=
 swords were like a badge of their rank, this changed over time. Also, the =
Samurai believed their swords had a soul. But, if you think about it, when =
everyone else has a sword to kill you with, wouldn't you value your own swo=
rds more?

3: The katana and wakizashi.

4: For killing people and making y=
ou look tough so that other people wouldn't try to kill you. The katana, wh=
ich was the longest of the two, was your main weapon, while the wakizashi w=
as your backup and the easiest sword to use in doors. You could use both sw=
ords together or just the best for the job at hand. Note that at some times=
 the samurai might only have his wakizashi, such as when in court.

7: Bush=
ido means "way of the warrior" or "warrior way" and was a set of principles=
 Samurai were supposed to live by, very much like the European knights code=
 of chivalry.
